Six Houston chefs may be among those vying for the James Beard Award for Best Chef Southwest. 
Manabu Horiuchi of Kata Robata, Anita Jaisinghani of Pondicheri, Hugo Ortega of Hugo's, Seth Siegel-Gardner and Terrence Gallivan of The Pass & Provisions, and Jianyun Ye of Mala Sichuan all found themselves as semifinalists for Best Chef Southwest on Wednesday when the James Beard Foundation released the semifinals list for its prestigious awards, considered the Oscars of the food world. 
NEW RESTAURANT: Award-winning Austin chef opening in Houston 
It was a good day for Houston. Other semifinalists included Anvil Bar & Refuge for Outstanding Bar Program; Tracy Vaught of H Town Restaurant Group (Hugo's, Caracol, Backstreet Café, Xochi) for Outstanding Restaurateur; Hugo's for Outstanding Service; and William Wright of Helen Greek Food and Wine for Rising Star Chef of the Year. Additionally, Ford Fry of Atlanta, who owns State of Grace in Houston, was a semifinalists for Outstanding Restaurateur, as was Sam Fox of Fox Restaurant Concepts which has True Food Kitchen and North Italia in Houston. 
The Chef and owner of Himalaya's in Houston show how to make their top spicy dish, a Houstonian favorite. Media: MediaOS Video 
If Ortega makes it to the finals, it will be his sixth nomination for Best Chef Southwest. 
The finalists will be announced on March 15 and the restaurant and chef awards will be presented on May 1 at the James Beard Foundation Awards Gala at the Lyric Opera of Chicago.
